title: Hotel Guests and Employees Trapped by Flooding in Beaumont, Texas
text:
Guests were stuck at the MCM Elegante Hotel in Beaumont, Texas, on September 19 as Tropical Depression Imelda brought heavy rainfall and flash flooding to the area.

Guadalupe Torres, who recorded this footage, told Storyful he was at the hotel for work when the flooding started. He was forced to move his truck to higher ground.

The video shows hotel guests walking in ankle-deep water and trying to move their cars. The footage also shows bushes and cars almost completely submerged.

National Weather Service Houston issued a flash flood emergency and urged anyone in the area to avoid walking or driving through the flood waters, and to move to higher ground.

Torres told Storyful his room is on the fifth floor, and people on lower levels were forced to move up.

“I can’t leave. None of us here at the hotel can leave,” he said. “We are stuck here.” Credit: Guadalupe Torres via Storyful
